_accidents.CI_OtherType: Revised contractor startup policy and procedures

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION & EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



Saputo is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is inherent to a comprehensive accidental release prevention program in place that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with the processes at our facility. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances.  If such a release does occur, our employees are trained to follow the Emergency Action Plan and to evacuate the facility as necessary. We are also coordinated with the Stanislaus County which provides additional emergency response expertise.



FACILITY INFORMATION & REGULATED SUBSTANCES



The Saputo Cheese USA, INC - Newman     facility is located at 691 Inyo Street in Newman, California, approximately two blocks east of State Highway 33. The plant's primary products include packaged provolone and mozzarella cheese for the wholesale and retail markets and liquid Whey processing. The facility employs approximately 135 full-time employees. There is one RMP-regulated substance, anhydrous ammonia, used in the plant's refrigeration system to provide refrigeration for processing and cold storage of dairy food products. This system contains 13,128 lbs of anhydrous ammonia.



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM & CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



The Saputo Cheese - Newman plant follows the 14 elements of the OSHA CalARP/Process Safety Management program as a release prevention program for RMP. In addition, Saputo Corporate - Department of Environmental Affairs works with the plant confirming regulatory and corporate standards are being followed, providing guidance and standardization on the RMP and OSHA CalARP/PSM programs and acting as a resource for the plant on the RMP, PSM and other environmental programs.



THE FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There has been one accidental r

elease of ammonia at this Saputo Cheese USA facility in the past five years that is subject to the CalARP or EPA Accidental Release Prevention Program five-year accident history reporting requirements.  The release caused one minor injury and occurred March 31, 2011.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



Saputo Cheese - Newman developed an Emergency Action Plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials as well as other emergency events that might occur at the plant. The purpose of Saputo's Emergency Action Plan is to ensure employees know and understand what to do in the event of an emergency in order to minimize injuries and property damage. The plan includes various aspects of an emergency including adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, and notification of local emergency response agencies. Specific employees are trained and certified as medical responders. All employees are trained in evacuation, hazard communication, and chemical safety. In addition, the plan is promptly updated to reflect pertinent changes.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Several developments and findings have resulted from the implementation of the various elements of our accidental release prevention program. Recommendations resulting from the PHA, compliance audits and mechanical integrity inspections will be addressed in a timely manner. In addition, regular interaction with Saputo Corporate - Department of Environmental Affairs, Health & Safety and Risk Group will improve compliance and overall plant safety.
